If you want to use the DeDuplicator add-on rather than the built in dup det=
ectors you should...

... download http://vefsafn.is/deduplicator_release/d=
eduplicator-3.0.0-SNAPSHOT-20120601-dist.tar.gz
... extract into $HERITRIX_=
HOME
... run $HERITRIX_HOME/dedup It will let you build an index of your ex=
isting content using crawl.log from previous crawl. Run with --help for det=
ails
... Add deduplicator processor to the crawl order cxml file, e.g.:

  =
<!-- DeDuplicator module defined -->
  <bean id=3D"deduplicator" class=3D"i=
s.landsbokasafn.deduplicator.DeDuplicator">
    <property name=3D"indexLoca=
tion" value=3D"<ENTER FULL PATH>" />
    <!-- <property name=3D"matchingMet=
hod" value=3D"URL" /> -->
    <property name=3D"jumpTo" value=3D"dispositio=
n" />
    <!-- <property name=3D"origin" value=3D"" /> -->
    <property na=
me=3D"tryEquivalent" value=3D"true" />
    <property name=3D"mimeFilter" va=
lue=3D"^text/html" />
    <!-- <property name=3D"blacklist" value=3D"true" =
/> -->
    <!-- <property name=3D"analyzeTimestamp" value=3D"false" /> -->
=
    <!-- <property name=3D"changeContentSize" value=3D"false" /> -->
    <!=
-- <property name=3D"statsPerHost" value=3D"false" /> -->
    <property nam=
e=3D"originHandling" value=3D"INDEX" />
  </bean>

And then in the FetchCha=
in, add after the FetchHTTP processor:

  <ref bean=3D"deduplicator" />

In=
formation on the options in the processor is on http://deduplicator.sourcef=
orge.net/started.html

NOTE: In the default configuration it will only inde=
x and deduplicate content whose mimetype does NOT match "^text/.*". This is=
 because text content is usually small, often very dynamic (always changing=
) and compresses well. Since the size of the index affects performance, it =
is best to skip text documents (such as HTML pages). This can be easily mod=
ified by setting -m and -o settings on the indexer and the "mimeFilter" and=
 "blacklist" on the processor to ".*" and "true" respectively.

- Kris
